before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2s9c","text":"When using GalaxyTrakr, it is recommended to use Google Chrome for optimal browser experience although Microsoft Edge and Safari are also compatible browsers. Internet Explorer and Mozilla FireFox are NOT compatible with GalaxyTrakr.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"64usi","text":"Salmonella serotypes are defined by two surface structures, O antigen and two H antigens. Traditional serotype determination is performed with the Salmonella serological somatic (O) and flagellar (H) tests and paired with biochemical confirmation. More than 2,600 Salmonella serotypes have been described in the White-Kauffmann-Le Minor scheme. Molecular methods for serotype determination have been developed based on genes responsible for serotype antigens. These genes are encoded in the rfb gene cluster, fliC, and fljB. SeqSero2 is a bioinformatic pipeline that uses whole genome sequence (WGS) data from pure-culture isolates to perform in silico analysis to determine the antigenic formula, including somatic (O) antigens and both flagellar (H) antigens. This provides continuity with the well-established scheme for phenotypic Salmonella serotypes.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":147,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":264,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":491,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":509,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":519,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":643,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":835,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6e0g","text":"PURPOSE:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54m7c","text":"This document outlines the steps required to run SeqSero2 v1.1.1 on a collection of isolates in the GalaxyTrakr environment. This is performed by utilizing a custom workflow called “SeqSero2 v1.1.1 collection workflow” and downloading the resulting table.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du38o","text":"SCOPE: This protocol covers the following tasks:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4emm2","text":"1. set up an account in GalaxyTrakr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58fvl","text":"2. Create a new history/workspace","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70nbo","text":"3. Upload data","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50a4c","text":"4. Execute the SeqSero2 workflow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ma70","text":"5. Download the results","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ug04","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"rqpe","text":"Please note that this protocol is public domain, which supersedes the CC-BY license default used by protocols.io.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Gangiredla, J., Rand, H., Benisatto, D. et al. GalaxyTrakr: a distributed analysis tool for public health whole genome sequence data accessible to non-bioinformaticians. BMC Genomics 22, 114 (2021).

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

After this workflow is imported it will be available for use in your Tools Panel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csba3","text":"If your data is already in GalaxyTrakr, open the history containing that data to be analyzed or move the data to a new history for analysis and proceed to Step #. This option may be preferred if the data was already uploaded for other purposes such as MicroRunQC.  It’s ok if there are non-Salmonella isolates in your dataset.They will not return an antigenic formula or serovar name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":155,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":290,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k0jb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uo5r","text":"For uploading new data proceed to next step to create a new history and upload your data to be analyzed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
